entry.title: Roseburg hits 105°F, breaking August 11 record - hottest day of 2025 so far
entry.summary: Monday reached 105°F at the airport, the hottest day of 2025 so far and a new Aug. 11 record (old mark 104° in 2014). Tuesday should top out near 100°, below the 1935 record (106°). Gradual cooling begins Wednesday, with near-normal highs by Thursday.

entry.title: Summertime road resurfacing is end of August
entry.summary: Streets in southeastern Roseburg will be resurfaced Aug. 28 and 29, weather permitting.

entry.title: ROSEBURG HAS HOTTEST DAY OF THE YEAR MONDAY, BREAKS RECORD FOR THE DATE
entry.summary: August 12, 2025 4:10 a.m. Monday was the hottest day of the year so far in Roseburg, and the high temperature broke the record high for the date. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 105 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport....

entry.title: FIRE DANGER LEVEL INCREASES TO EXTREME IN JACKSON AND JOSEPHINE COUNTIES
entry.summary: August 12, 2025 3:50 a.m. Due to dry vegetation, fire behavior and windy conditions, the fire danger level on lands protected by the Oregon Department of Forestry in Jackson and Josephine counties has increased to “extreme” as of Tuesday morning. An update said these regulations impact 1.8 million acres of state, private, county, city and...

entry.title: ROSEBURG SUMMERTIME ROAD RESURFACING STARTS THURDAY
entry.summary: August 12, 2025 3:40 a.m. Maintenance to extend the life of about 2.6 miles of streets in southeastern Roseburg is set to begin on Thursday, weather permitting. A city release said the Roseburg Public Works Department asks vehicle owners to remove their vehicles from street sections scheduled and posted for maintenance to allow crews to...

entry.title: WINSTON CITY COUNCIL WITH SPECIAL MEETING TUESDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: August 12, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Winston City Council will have a special meeting Tuesday night. It will be held at 7:00 p.m. in the council chambers on Northwest Douglas Boulevard. The meeting is regarding the sustainability of the General Fund of the City of Winston budget. For more information, contact City Recorder Cindy Sarti...

entry.title: $35 MILLION INVESTMENT HONORS VETERANS FOR NEW ROSEBURG FACILITY
entry.summary: August 12, 2025 3:20 a.m. A major step forward for Oregon’s veterans has been announced with the approval of $35 million in funding for the construction of a new veteran’s home in Roseburg. A joint release from state representatives Virgle Osborne, Court Boice, and Alek Skarlatos along with State Senator David Brock Smith said the...

entry.title: REPRESENTATIVE OSBORNE CELEBRATES FUNDING FOR COMMUNITY CANCER CENTER
entry.summary: August 12, 2025 3:05 a.m. Last week Governor Kotek signed HB 5006, a major appropriations bill that included $176,721 in funding for the Community Cancer Center in Roseburg. The non-profit center, which provides high-quality radiation therapy services, will use the funds to significantly enhance its cancer treatment infrastructure. State Representative Virgle Osborne said, “The funds...

entry.title: H.O.P.E DRUG COURT TO CELEBRATE 110TH GRADUATION
entry.summary: August 12, 2025 2:50 a.m. The 110th H.O.P.E. Drug Court graduation is scheduled for Tuesday, August 26th beginning at 5:15 p.m. to celebrate Robert Byant, Brittany Holmes, Kristy Parham, and Rachel Stauffer. entry.title: Roseburg Woman Killed, Driver Injured In Garden Valley Road Head-On Crash
entry.summary: Kaylie Ann York, 23, passed away when her 2015 Mazda 6 crossed into the westbound lane and struck a 2019 Toyota Tacoma head-on on Garden Valley Rd near Ridgewood Dr on Aug. 8, 2025. The Tacoma driver, Frank Edward Pollak, 66, sustained serious but non-life-threatening injuries.

entry.title: Douglas District reminds public of extreme fire danger after recent blazes

entry.title: Reedsport flushes water system this week
entry.summary: The Reedsport Fire Department will be performing water system/fire hydrant flushing on all streets on the north side of Highway 101 from 16th Street to Port Dock Road.

entry.title: Roseburg woman dies in two-vehicle, head-on Douglas County crash
entry.summary: A 23-year-old Roseburg woman died Friday morning following a two-vehicle, head-on crash in Douglas County, according to the Oregon State Police.

entry.summary: GREEN DISTRICT — A contractor with the Oregon Department of Transportation is continuing work on a nearly $12 million long-term project on Oregon 42 between Winston and the Green District.

entry.title: Avista began pipeline construction Wednesday
entry.summary: Avista and Canyon Pipeline Inc. contract crews began the process of installing 8,250 feet of 6-inch polyethylene gas main pipe on Wednesday at 7:30 a.m. The project impacts traffic on Old Melrose Road in Roseburg.
